topic.title: Inserting Media Objects in DITA Topics

body.p: provides support for inserting audio and video media content in DITA topics. There is a toolbar button () that allows you to insert and configure a reference to a media object (such as audio clips, videos files, or embedded HTML frames).

section.title: Adding a Media Object
section.p: To insert a media object in a DITA document, use the following procedure:

ol.li: Place the cursor at the location where you want the graphic to be inserted.

Select the Insert Media Object action. The Insert Media File dialog box appears.
Insert Media File Dialog Box

Configure the options in this dialog box and click Insert.
The Insert Media File dialog box includes the following options for inserting media object into a DITA document:
URL Use this option to specify a URL for a media object. It will insert the URL as the value of a data attribute inside an object element. You can type the URL of the media object you want to insert or use the Browse drop-down menu to select the media object.
Keyref You can use the Choose Key Reference button to open the Choose Key dialog box that presents the list of keys available in the selected root map. Use this dialog box to insert the selected key as the value a datakeyref attribute inside an object element. All keys that are presented in the dialog box are gathered from the root map of the current DITA map. Elements that have the keyref attribute set are displayed as links.If your defined keys are not listed in this dialog box, it is most likely trying to gather keys from the wrong root map. You can change the root map by using the Change Root Map link.
Type Select the type of media object you selected. You can choose between: audio, video, or iframe.
Size Use this section to configure the Width and Height of the media object. Specifying a value in these options inserts a width and height attribute, respectively.
